name: Folly of Steel
text:
Folly of Steel
by Harjeld Ironbane


At dawn, for battle you stand clad in steel with shield in hand safe and sound within your shell safe from danger wherever it may dwell Impervious thou art, to blade, club or dart.

slew men and mer left and right walked woundless from every fight safe you are within your shell safe from danger no matter how fell Impervious thou art, to blade, club or dart.

At dawn, for battle you stand before you a wizard, staff in hand stowed away within your shell the wizard spoke and did cast a spell Impervious thou art, to blade, club or dart.

The wizard you would crush but your straps they turn to mush The wizard should be struck! No! your hinges fast are stuck! Though victory is a must! Alas your steel it turns to rust. Remember, O warrior, my dreaded name! That name the name of Ironbane.
